at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.intf

Class BufferManager.Implementation

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.intf.AbstractClientImplementation
      • at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.intf.BufferManager.Implementation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ValueChangeObserver
    Enclosing class:
    BufferManager

    private class BufferManager.Implementation
extends AbstractClientImplementation
implements ValueChangeObserver
    Due to information hiding issues, the functionality of a buffer manager isn't implemented in the class BufferManager itself. This inner class is the real implementation of a buffer manager.

    To prevent useless instances of this class - not regular released objects - there must not exist any hard reference to this class except the only one in the BufferManager class. The ClientEndpoint class uses weak references only, to notify used data points about spontaneous value changes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Implementation()
      Initializes a new instance of DataPoint.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Implementation

        Implementation()
        Initializes a new instance of DataPoint. After initialization, there are no buffers assigned.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        BufferConfiguration get(java.lang.String name)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method returns the configuration of a buffer.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the buffer
        Returns:
        the configuration of this buffer. The result may be null, if no communication with the buffer daemon is possible.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the buffer is unknown

      • update

        boolean update(java.lang.String name,
               BufferConfiguration configuration,
               boolean createAllowed)
        This method makes an update of the buffer configuration.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the buffer
        configuration - the buffer configuration
        createAllowed - if the creation of a new buffer is allowed
        Returns:
        true, if the configuration was successfully changed in the daemon

      • remove

        public boolean remove(java.lang.String name)
        This method releases the buffer with the given name and removes it from the set of known buffers.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the buffer
        Returns:
        true, if the configuration was successfully changed in the daemon
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the buffer is unknown
